instruction: Can hyperspectral imaging be considered a superior method compared to traditional methods for determining the volatile oil and moisture content of Zanthoxylum bungeanum and classifying its geographical origin?

Additionally, support vector machines (SVM) were used to classify the geographical origin of Z. bungeanum samples with a high accuracy of 97.29% in the prediction set. Therefore, based on these findings, hyperspectral imaging can be considered a superior method for determining the volatile oil and moisture content and classifying the geographical origin of Z. bungeanum compared to traditional methods.
